sentences.zh: 《夏書》曰：禹抑洪水十三年，過家不入門。

translations.idiomatic: On land he traveled by cart, on water by boat, through mud he stepped on rushes, through mountains he used bridges.

translations.literal: To distinguish nine provinces, following mountains dredged rivers, according to soil made tribute.
translations.idiomatic: To distinguish the nine provinces, following the mountains he dredged the rivers, according to the soil he established tributes.

sentences.zh: 通九道，陂九澤，度九山。

translations.literal: Opened nine roads, dammed nine marshes, crossed nine mountains.
translations.idiomatic: He opened nine roads, dammed nine marshes, and crossed nine mountains.

sentences.zh: 然河菑衍溢，害中國也尤甚。

translations.literal: Yet river disasters spread overflowed, harmed China especially severely.

sentences.zh: 唯是為務。

translations.literal: Only this made task.
translations.idiomatic: He made only this his task.

sentences.zh: 故道河自積石歷龍門，南到華陰，東下砥柱，及孟津、雒汭，至于大邳。

translations.literal: Therefore guided river from Ji Shi through Long Men, south arrived Hua Yin, east down Di Zhu, and Meng Jin, Luo Rui, until Da Pei.

sentences.zh: 於是禹以為河所從來者高，水湍悍，難以行平地，數為敗，乃二渠以引其河。

translations.literal: Therefore Yu thought river source high, water turbulent fierce, difficult flow flat land, frequently caused breaches, then two channels to divert its river.

The nine rivers were dredged, the nine marshes drained, the various Xia were peaceful, and the merit extended to the Three Dynasties.

translations.idiomatic: In Wu, he opened channels to the Three Jiang and Five Lakes.

translations.idiomatic: In Qi, he connected between Zi and Ji.

translations.literal: In Shu, Shu governor Bing chiseled Li Dui, avoided Mo Shui harm, pierced two rivers Chengdu middle.
translations.idiomatic: In Shu, the Shu governor Bing chiseled Li Dui, avoided the harm of Mo Shui, and pierced the two rivers through Chengdu's middle.

sentences.zh: 此渠皆可行舟，有餘則用溉浸，百姓饗其利。

translations.literal: These channels all could carry boats, when surplus then used irrigate soak, people enjoyed its benefits.
translations.idiomatic: These channels could all carry boats; when there was surplus water it was used for irrigation, and the people enjoyed its benefits.

translations.literal: As to places passed, often led their water moreover used irrigate fields channels, counted in ten thousand hundred million, yet none sufficient to enumerate.

translations.idiomatic: When Han heard that Qin liked to start projects, they wanted to stop Qin from doing so, to prevent eastward attacks; they sent water engineer Zheng Guo to secretly persuade Qin to dig the Jing River from Zhong Shan west Di Hulu mouth as a canal, along the north mountain eastward flowing to the Luo for over three hundred li, intending to irrigate fields.

translations.literal: Middle work and aware, Qin wanted kill Zheng Guo.
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the work they became aware of the scheme; Qin wanted to kill Zheng Guo.

translations.literal: Zheng Guo said: 'Beginning minister did secretly, yet canal complete also Qin benefit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Guo said: 'At first I acted secretly, but the completed canal will also benefit Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦以為然，卒使就渠。

translations.idiomatic: The canal completed; using the water that filled and blocked, it irrigated over forty thousand qing of salty alkali land; the harvest was one zhong per mu.

sentences.zh: 於是關中為沃野，無凶年，秦以富彊，卒并諸侯，因命曰鄭國渠。

translations.literal: Therefore Guan Zhong became fertile fields, no famine years, Qin thereby rich strong, finally united feudal lords, therefore named Zheng Guo Canal.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Guan Zhong became fertile fields with no famine years; Qin thereby grew rich and strong, finally uniting the feudal lords; thus it was named the Zheng Guo Canal.

sentences.zh: 漢興三十九年，孝文時河決酸棗，東潰金隄，於是東郡大興卒塞之。

translations.literal: Han rise thirty nine years, Xiao Wen time Yellow River burst Suan Zao, east burst Jin Di, therefore Dong Jun greatly raised troops blocked it.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-nine years after Han's rise, during Emperor Xiao Wen's time, the Yellow River burst at Suan Zao, bursting eastward through the Jin dike; Dong Commandery therefore greatly raised troops to block it.

sentences.zh: 其後四十有餘年，今天子元光之中，而河決於瓠子，東南注鉅野，通於淮、泗。

translations.literal: Its after forty more years, now Son of Heaven Yuan Guang middle, and Yellow River burst at Hulu Zi, southeast poured Ju Ye, connected to Huai, Si.
translations.idiomatic: Over forty years later, now in the middle of the present Son of Heaven's Yuan Guang era, the Yellow River burst at Hulu Zi, flowing southeast into Ju Ye, connecting to the Huai and Si Rivers.

sentences.zh: 於是天子使汲黯、鄭當時興人徒塞之，輒復壞。

translations.literal: Therefore Son of Heaven made Ji An, Zheng Dang Shi raise people troops block it, then again broke.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Son of Heaven sent Ji An and Zheng Dang Shi to raise people and troops to block it, but it repeatedly broke again.

sentences.zh: 是時武安侯田蚡為丞相，其奉邑食鄃。

translations.literal: This time Wu An Hou Tian Fen was Chancellor, his fief ate Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the Marquis of Wu An, Tian Fen, was Chancellor; his fiefdom drew sustenance from Zhu.

sentences.zh: 鄃居河北，河決而南則鄃無水菑，邑收多。

translations.literal: Zhu located north of Yellow River, Yellow River burst south then Zhu no water disaster, fief harvest much.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu was located north of the Yellow River; if the river burst southward, Zhu would have no water disasters, and the fiefdom's harvests would be plentiful.

sentences.zh: 蚡言於上曰：「江河之決皆天事，未易以人力為彊塞，塞之未必應天。」

translations.literal: Fen spoke to emperor: 'Yangtze Yellow River bursts all heaven affairs, not easy with human force strongly block, block it not necessarily respond to heaven.'
translations.idiomatic: Fen spoke to the emperor: 'The bursting of the Yangtze and Yellow Rivers are all matters of heaven; it is not easy to strongly block them with human force; blocking them may not accord with heaven's will.'

sentences.zh: 而望氣用數者亦以為然。

translations.literal: And those who watched qi used numbers also considered it so.
translations.idiomatic: Those who observed qi and used divination numbers also considered it so.

sentences.zh: 於是天子久之不事復塞也。

translations.literal: Therefore Son of Heaven long time not undertake again block also.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Son of Heaven for a long time did not undertake to block it again.

sentences.zh: 是時鄭當時為大農，言曰：「異時關東漕粟從渭中上，度六月而罷，而漕水道九百餘里，時有難處。

translations.literal: This time Zheng Dang Shi was Grand Agrarian, spoke: 'Different time Guan Dong transported grain from Wei middle up, estimated six months and stop, and transported water route nine hundred more li, sometimes had difficult places.'
translations.idiomatic: At this time Zheng Dang Shi was Grand Agrarian; he said: 'In former times, Guan Dong transported grain up from the middle of the Wei, taking an estimated six months to complete; the transport water route was over nine hundred li, and sometimes had difficult places.'

sentences.zh: 引渭穿渠起長安，并南山下，至河三百餘里，徑，易漕，度可令三月罷；

translations.literal: Lead Wei dig canal start Chang An, along south mountain down, to Yellow River three hundred more li, direct, easy transport, estimated can make three months stop;

sentences.zh: 而渠下民田萬餘頃，又可得以溉田：此損漕省卒，而益肥關中之地，得穀。」

translations.literal: And canal below people fields ten thousand more qing, also can use to irrigate fields: this reduce transport save troops, and benefit fertilize Guan Zhong land, get grain.
translations.idiomatic: And below the canal are over ten thousand qing of people's fields, which can also be used to irrigate fields: this reduces transport and saves troops, while benefiting and fertilizing Guan Zhong's land to obtain grain.'

sentences.zh: 天子以為然，令齊人水工徐伯表，悉發卒數萬人穿漕渠，三歲而通。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven considered it so, ordered Qi person water engineer Xu Bo Biao, all raised troops several ten thousand dig transport canal, three years and connected.

sentences.zh: 通，以漕，大便利。

translations.idiomatic: Connected; used for transport; greatly convenient.

sentences.zh: 穀從渭上，與關中無異，而砥柱之東可無復漕。」

translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven considered it so; he raised several tens of thousands of troops to make canal fields.

sentences.zh: 且褒斜材木竹箭之饒，擬於巴蜀。」

translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven considered it so; he appointed Tang Zi Ang as Han Zhong governor and raised several tens of thousands to make the Bao Xie road over five hundred li.

translations.idiomatic: Afterward Zhuang Xiong Pi spoke: 'Lin Jin people wish to dig the Luo to irrigate the over ten thousand qing of former salty alkali land east of Chong Quan.'

translations.literal: Truly get water, can make mu ten shi.

translations.idiomatic: Therefore they raised over ten thousand troops to dig the canal, leading the Luo water from Zheng to below Shang Yan mountain.

translations.idiomatic: The banks easily collapsed; they then dug wells, the deep ones over forty zhang.

translations.idiomatic: Water floated to cross Shang Yan, eastward to the mountain ridge over ten li between.

translations.idiomatic: At this time Dong Jun burned grass; because firewood was scarce, they cut down the bamboo from Qi garden to make stakes.

translations.idiomatic: Long roads relaxed, departing the normal flow; flood dragons gallop, just embarking on far travels.

sentences.zh: 歸舊川兮神哉沛，不封禪兮安知外！

translations.literal: Return old channel ah spirit ah full, not feng shan ah how know outer!
translations.idiomatic: Return to the old channel, spirit fully present; not performing feng shan, how to know the outer!

sentences.zh: 為我謂河伯兮何不仁，泛濫不止兮愁吾人？

translations.literal: For me tell River Earl ah why not benevolent, overflowing not stop ah worry my people?
translations.idiomatic: For me tell the River Earl, why so unkind; overflowing without stop, troubling my people?

sentences.zh: 齧桑浮兮淮、泗滿，久不反兮水維緩。」

translations.literal: Gnaw mulberry float ah Huai, Si full, long not return ah water only slow.
translations.idiomatic: Gnawing mulberry floats, Huai and Si full; long not returning, water only slow.'

sentences.zh: 一曰：「河湯湯兮激潺湲，北渡污兮浚流難。

translations.literal: One said: 'River boiling boiling ah rush gurgling, north cross dirty ah dredge flow difficult.'
translations.idiomatic: Another said: 'The river boils and rushes gurgling; north crossing the mire, dredging the flow is difficult.'

sentences.zh: 搴長茭兮沈美玉，河伯許兮薪不屬。

translations.literal: Pluck long reeds ah sink beautiful jade, River Earl promised ah firewood not continuous.
translations.idiomatic: Pluck long reeds and sink beautiful jade; the River Earl promised, but firewood is not continuous.'

sentences.zh: 薪不屬兮衛人罪，燒蕭條兮噫乎何以御水！

translations.literal: Firewood not continuous ah Wei people crime, burn desolate ah sigh ah what with control water!
translations.idiomatic: Firewood not continuous, the Wei people's crime; burn desolate, sigh, what to control the water with!'

sentences.zh: 穨林竹兮楗石菑，宣房塞兮萬福來。」

translations.literal: Bundle forest bamboo ah stake stone dike, Xuan Fang blocked ah ten thousand blessings come.
translations.idiomatic: Bundle forest bamboo and stake stone dikes; Xuan Fang blocked, ten thousand blessings come.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒塞瓠子，筑宮其上，名曰宣房宮。

translations.literal: Therefore finally blocked Hulu Zi, built palace on it, named Xuan Fang Palace.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they finally blocked Hulu Zi; built a palace on it, named Xuan Fang Palace.

sentences.zh: 而道河北行二渠，復禹舊跡，而梁、楚之地復寧，無水災。

translations.literal: And led north Yellow River two canals, restored Yu old traces, and Liang, Chu lands again peaceful, no water disaster.
translations.idiomatic: And led north along the Yellow River with two canals, restored Yu's old traces; and the lands of Liang and Chu again became peaceful, without water disasters.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，用事者爭言水利。

translations.literal: From this after, those in power competed spoke water benefits.
translations.idiomatic: From this time on, those in power competed to speak of water benefits.

sentences.zh: 朔方、西河、河西、酒泉皆引河及川谷以溉田；

translations.literal: Shuo Fang, Xi He, He Xi, Jiu Quan all led Yellow River and streams valleys to irrigate fields;
translations.idiomatic: Shuo Fang, Xi He, He Xi, Jiu Quan all led the Yellow River and stream valleys to irrigate fields;

sentences.zh: 而關中輔渠、靈軹引堵水；

translations.literal: And Guan Zhong Fu Canal, Ling Zhi led Du water;
translations.idiomatic: And Guan Zhong's Fu Canal and Ling Zhi led Du water;

sentences.zh: 汝南、九江引淮；

translations.literal: Ru Nan, Jiu Jiang led Huai;
translations.idiomatic: Ru Nan and Jiu Jiang led the Huai;

sentences.zh: 東海引鉅定；

translations.literal: Dong Hai led Ju Ding;
translations.idiomatic: Dong Hai led Ju Ding;

sentences.zh: 泰山下引汶水：皆穿渠為溉田，各萬餘頃。

translations.literal: Tai Shan below led Wen water: all dug canals for irrigating fields, each ten thousand more qing.
translations.idiomatic: Below Tai Shan led Wen water: all dug canals for irrigating fields, each over ten thousand qing.

sentences.zh: 佗小渠披山通道者，不可勝言。

translations.literal: Other small canals split mountains opened roads ones, cannot all be spoken.
translations.idiomatic: Other small canals that split mountains and opened roads cannot all be spoken of.

sentences.zh: 然其著者在宣房。

translations.literal: Yet their famous ones in Xuan Fang.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the most famous of them was in Xuan Fang.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余南登廬山，觀禹疏九江，遂至于會稽太湟，上姑蘇，望五湖；

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I south ascended Lu Shan, viewed Yu dredged nine Jiang, then arrived at Hui Ji Tai Huang, ascended Gu Su, gazed five lakes;
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I south ascended Lu Shan, viewed how Yu dredged the nine Jiang, then arrived at Hui Ji Tai Huang; ascended Gu Su, gazed at the five lakes;

sentences.zh: 東闚洛汭、大邳，迎河，行淮、泗、濟、漯洛渠；

translations.literal: East peeked Luo Rui, Da Pi, met Yellow River, traveled Huai, Si, Ji, Ta Luo canals;
translations.idiomatic: East I peered at Luo Rui and Da Pi, met the Yellow River, traveled the Huai, Si, Ji, and Ta Luo canals;

sentences.zh: 西瞻蜀之岷山及離碓；

translations.literal: West gazed Shu Min Shan and Li Dui;
translations.idiomatic: West I gazed at Shu's Min Shan and Li Dui;

sentences.zh: 北自龍門至于朔方。

translations.literal: North from Long Men to Shuo Fang.
translations.idiomatic: North from Long Men to Shuo Fang.

sentences.zh: 曰：甚哉，水之為利害也！

translations.literal: Said: Extreme ah, water as benefit harm also!
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'How extreme are water's benefits and harms!'

sentences.zh: 余從負薪塞宣房，悲瓠子之詩而作河渠書。

translations.literal: I followed carried firewood blocked Xuan Fang, grieved Hulu Zi poem and made Yellow River Canals book.
translations.idiomatic: I followed carrying firewood to block Xuan Fang; grieved by the Hulu Zi poem, I made the Yellow River Canals book.
